reviewText: Starring the great actor Robert Donat (The 39 Steps, Goodbye Mr Chips), this biopic chronicles the life of William Friese-Greene, the lesser known inventor of the movie camera. An all-time favorite film, sure to be a delight if one has never had the pleasure of seeing it. Glad it's now available in this restoration.

While most people think Thomas Edison, invented motion pictures, you will find out that Mr. William Friese Greene, was the true inventor of motion pictures as we know it. The ups and downs in his life and the women, he loved.
